Oh...Sir! Is a hiarious turn based linguistic puzzle game of sorts. The storyline is like something straight out of a Montey Python bit, whereas a constumer has returned to the show from which he has purchased an ex-parrot, it is no more, it has ceased to be. Players take turns exchanging insults piece by piece. A turn is completed when a player has selected a short phrase from a joint word bank or a personal work bank or when their time has run out. A round ends when both players are ready to insult eachother or when there are no more phrases left to be had. The game ends when one of the two player's HP bars reaches zero. The game is actually rather fast paced with limited time to read options and decide on the best course of action before time expires on your turn. For a game completed in 42 hours it's actually pretty awesome. I would have liked a handful of more phrase options through which to cycle for subsiquent rounds of play, but again, 42 hours. reviewText: CS:GO Chat Simulator 2015

Oh...Sir! is a self-styled multi player insult game. It is a variant of the game consequences, where players take it in turns to complete a phrase from fragments given onstcreen. The score is calculated by the computer and your opponent is wounded by an amount dependin gon how sucessful your insult was. Its fun, but I broke the game in 5 minutes, running out of insults for one side. Even with his health depleted the game did not end.
Its quite funny at times, using many phrases from Monty Python, however the scoring seems somewhat arbitrary and the random combination produces some surreal insults: Your cousins car is your father... seemed to be the phrase that killed the game.

All in all, the game is an amusing diversion, and is free to play. I would recommend taking a look.
